tooltip_descriptions.NUM: Allocates a numeric variable with name A, and optionally, sets it to value B.
tooltip_descriptions.WINDOW: Creates a graphics window with buffer mode A, width B, height C.
tooltip_descriptions.GREATER: Compares the numbers A and B and jumps to the address C if A is greater than B.
tooltip_descriptions.PIXEL: Sets the color of the pixel at (X, Y) in the window to (R, G, B).
tooltip_descriptions.ADDRESS:
If this is the first time this function is called, it allocates and stores it's own address in the address A.
If it has been called before, it jumps the execution to the address stored in A.
tooltip_descriptions.JUMP:
Jumps the execution to line A. This is fragile. 
It is highly recommended to use ADDRESS or FUNC instead.
tooltip_descriptions.BUFFER:
Buffers the window if the window is in buffer mode 0. This is required to display rendered graphics,
but is quite expensive.
tooltip_descriptions.PRINT: Outputs all arguments appended together as text to the console.
tooltip_descriptions.TIME: Outputs the current time since execution to A.
tooltip_descriptions.KEY:
Outputs 1 to B if key A is pressed. 
A must be a lowercase key name (e.g. esc, a, enter, space).
tooltip_descriptions.INT: Outputs A rounded down to B.
tooltip_descriptions.STRING: Allocates a string variable with name A, and optionally, sets it to all additional arguments appended as text.
tooltip_descriptions.READ: Outputs data from the file at path A into string B.
tooltip_descriptions.WRITE: Writes data from string B into the file at path A.
tooltip_descriptions.MODULUS: Outputs the remainder of A/B into C.
tooltip_descriptions.REPLACE: Outputs A with all occurrences of B replaced with C into D.
tooltip_descriptions.INDEX: Returns the index of A within B.
tooltip_descriptions.SPLIT: Outputs A split into a list at all occurences of B (non-inclucive) into C.
tooltip_descriptions.RADICAL: Outputs the base B radical of A into C.
tooltip_descriptions.LEN: Outputs the length of A as text into B.
tooltip_descriptions.PC:
Returns the current execution address.
It is highly recommended to use ADDRESS or FUNC instead.
tooltip_descriptions.FUNC:
If this is the last time this function is called, it defines the function A. If it is not the last time,
it calls the function A.
tooltip_descriptions.FLOAT: Outputs A as a float to B.
tooltip_descriptions.RECT:
Draws a rectangle on the window with it's top-left corner at (X, Y), a width of W, a height of H,
and a color of (R, G, B).
tooltip_descriptions.TRIG:
Draws a triangle on the window with it's corners at (X1, Y1), (X2, Y2), and (X3, Y3),
and a color of (R, G, B).
tooltip_descriptions.GRADIENT:
Draws a rectangle on the window with it's top-left corner at (X, Y), a width of W, a height of H,
and a color ranging from (R1, G1, B1) to (R2, G2, B2) vertically if V=1 and horizontally if V=0.
tooltip_descriptions.DEBUG: Outputs the current memory state to the console.
tooltip_descriptions.HELP: Outputs a list of all functions with their descriptions and arguments to the console.
tooltip_descriptions.REDMOND_CORE: Tells the IDE to use the Core (SDL) interpreter (Redmond_Core.exe).
tooltip_descriptions.REDMOND_PYGAME: Tells the IDE to use the Pygame interpreter (Redmond_Pygame.exe).
tooltip_descriptions.JALLOC: Allocates data from json file A
tooltip_descriptions.MIN: Outputs the lesser of A and B into C.
tooltip_descriptions.MAX: Outputs the greater of A and B into C.
tooltip_descriptions.RETURN: Returns execution from the current function.
tooltip_descriptions.IMAGE:
Creates an image from file at path IMAGE cropped by (UVX, UVY, UVW, UVH [All values are normalized])
with a width of W and a height of H with filtering mode F and puts it in variable #OUT.
(0 = point, 1 = bilinear)
tooltip_descriptions.BLIT: Draws #IMAGE onto the screen at (X, Y) with roatation R.
tooltip_descriptions.DIM: Fetches the width and height of the image at path IMAGE and sets OUT to an array with index 0 = width and index 1 = height.
